alert.note: Alert for Orleans; Plaquemines (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 2:59PM CDT until August 10 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, Orleans and Plaquemines. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in urban, low-lying, and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 250 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain had fallen around midday. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Marrero, Harvey, Belle Chasse, Jefferson, Gretna, Westwego, Woodmere, Estelle and Bridge City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
